replies.msg: ä½†å…©å€‹æ”¾æ­£é¸åˆå””ä¿‚å¥½å¾— é˜²å®ˆæ¯”è¼ƒå·® æ”¾ä½¢åœ°æ‰“sub æ¯å ´éƒ½æ¯”æœ€å°‘50åˆ†ä½  æ­£é¸å·²ç¶“PGå¯æ„›è˜‡çˆ†æ‰“åº• å£“åŠ›ç´°å·¦å¥½å¤š

I'm a fan of Vince Carter. He was certainly an exciting slam dunker who was worth his weight in gold to Raptors. Don't get me wrong- I still enjoy watching him play even though his prime has passed. He proved his worth to Raptors by helping win multiple championships. His worth to the team was incalculable. I must say he's made dramatic progress with his three point shooting since he joined nets. Unfortunately his leg progress has progressed fairly quickly in the last four weeks causing him to be sidelined for six months with a bad leg injury. He complained that taking a six-month hiatus was too long but it's for his own good. He has a follow-up to the doctor next week. His friend LeBron James will also be out of commission until his back heals. He's made little progress with his shooting since he injured his back. His doctor said he was making good progress and will check on his progress next month. He assigned the blame for his injury to a lack of training and stretching. Oh well it could be worse. His worth of contribution to Lakers is incalculable. Lakers is as likely to win the finals next year as Warriors in my opinion. The other week Lakers didn't just beat Suns. They wiped the floor with Suns. Everybody was on the edge of their seats. LeBron yelled at Suns "Boo!" as Lakers won. Suns has lots its edge to some extent since its point leaders left the team. Recently Bulls edged out Suns by two points which reminded me of Warriors edging out Cavaliers by three points. The responsibilities of every coach in every team are well defined. Everyone has a vital role to play in every team. In addition the government has set up a commission to examine the use of steroids among players. Another commission has also been established to investigate family violence in NBA which I wholeheartedly support. My friend Alan got a front row ticket for the All-Star game which was very hard to buy. I said "Fair enough. It's difficult to get a front row ticket but you should ask your boss if you could take a few days off beforehand as you'll need to fly to America for it" He was too excited lol. Yesterday I had my personal training session in the gym and was soaking wet then I soaked in a jacuzzi. The gym is situated beside the jacuzzi where you can see the inside of the gym clearly. I saw a slim guy lift a light four pound dumbell for all he was worth but still couldn't complete the exercise. I enjoy hitting the gym and I know my personal trainer is worth her salt as I'm making good progress with my physique. She's a vivacious in-your-face woman who's sometimes too honest for her own good. I dislike working out in Physical Fitness because the salespeople there are way too in-your-face.

replies.msg: æ‰“ç©ºç‚®ä¸æœƒæ‡·å­•

I'm a fan of vince Carter. He was a very exciting slam dunker who was worth his weight in gold to Raptors. Don't get me wrong -i still enjoy watching him play even though he's past his prime. He proved his worth to Raptors by helping win multiple championships. His worth to the team was incalculable. I must say he's made significant progress with his three point shooting since he joined Nets. Unfortunately his leg injury has progressed fairly quickly over the last five weeks forcing him to be sidelined for three months because of his injury. He complained that taking a three-month hiatus was too long but it's for his own safety. He has a follow-up to the doctor next month. His friend LeBron James is also gonna be out of commission until his back heals. He's made slow but steady progress with his shooting since he injured his back. His doctor said he was making good progress and will check on his progress next month. He assigned the blame for his injury to a lack of stretching and training. Oh well it could be worse. His worth of contribution to Lakers is incalculable. Lakers is as likely to beat warriors as Cavaliers in my opinion. Recently Lakers didn't just beat Rockets. They wiped the floor with Rockets. LeBron cried to Rockets "in your face!" as Lakers won. Everyone was on the edge of their seats. Rockets has lost its edge to a certain extent since its point leafeds left the team. Just the other week Suns edged out rockets by four points which reminded me of warriors edging out Cavaliers by one point. The role of every coach in every team is clearly defined. Everybody has an important role to play in every team. In addition the government has established a commission to look at the use of steroids among players. Another commission has also been created to examine family violence in nba which I wholeheartedly support. My friend Alex bought a front row ticket for the All-Star game which was very hard to get. I said "fair enough. It's difficult to get a front row ticket but you should've asked your boss if you could get a few days off as you'll need to fly to America for it." He was too excited lol. Yesterday I had my personal training session and my vest was soaking wet then I soaked in a jacuzzi. The gym is situated beside the jacuzzi where you can see the inside of the gym clearly. I saw a slim guy lift a two pound dumbbell for all he was worth but still couldn't complete the exercise lol. I enjoy hitting the gym and I know my personal trainer is worth her salt as I'm making good progress with my physique. She's a vivacious in-your-face woman who's sometimes too honest for her own good. I dislike working out in Physical because the salespeople there are way too in-your-face.

Kobe Bryant's brother is my friend. Last week he was late because he got off at the wrong stop and had to wait for another train. I said "how on earth did you miss your stop?" He said "I'm sorry. What can I say?" I complimented him on his basketball skills. He then said "yes what can I say?" The current situation is very bad. I said "well yes what can I say?" Recently I was shocked when I saw a bus crash on the street. He said "I can imagine" His cousin too said "I'm sure you were"

replies.msg: Kobe Bryant's brother Joe is a gym membership salesman who's sending a follow-up email and making a follow-up call to a customer who's interested in joining the ten year membership. I used to work in a gym and whenever a customer paid a visit to the gym I always followed it up with a call or an email. Some of my colleagues followed it up with a visit to the customer. My friend Tom is interested in joining the gym. He had a meeting yesterday and a follow-up has been scheduled for tomorrow. He's also writing a follow-up to the acclaimed "the invisible man" so he's so busy that he won't have time to pay a follow-up visit to the gym. Therefore I handed tom the membership agreement for Joe and will follow up with him in the next couple days. The membership costs three thousand dollars a month which is well worth it for the whole range of facilities you can use. The membership grants you access to the gym as well as the swimming pool. They sell a tub of whey protein for three hundred and fifty dollars which is worth it as its normally twice as expensive. The cost of a tub of casein protein has edged higher by three dollars whereas that of soy protein has edged down by six dollars. The cost of creatine has edged lower to four hundred dollars while that of nitric oxide has edged up from four sixty to four hundred and eighty five dollars. Last friday Tom complained that he was treated badly at Starbucks. As a results s barista provided a referral to a senior staff member who in turn referred his case to the manager. He'll follow up with the manager on his case to be sure that it'll be dealt with seriously. In addition he's been suffering from a stomachache so I referred him to a gastroenterologist. Recently he posted on an online forum and suggested building an art gallery so as to boost tourism which was supported by many people on the forum. They asked the forum administrator for a referral to a district councilor. They'll follow up with the district councilor on the matter being discussed. I will follow up on the issue too. His suggestion of building an art museum is deemed appropriate. Just the other day Joe and I went to a museum where we looked at every huge nineteenth-century oil painting in minute detail so as not to miss any wonderful things. Yesterday Joe gave a party in a hotel instead of at his place so as not to disturb his neighbours.
